page.title: 19QUEEN'S SQUARE, HEMEL
page.content: Queen's Square is a{neighbourhood {shopping centre,}serving the area of Adeyfield, set up by the New Towns Commission. It was designed as an Italian Piazza and was opened in 1953. It contains shops, community centre, library, church (with an unfinished tower) and pub. There are flats over the shops. The square is now a car park, without a fountain! The square is in a rather run down state with much graffiti. Easy{parking}draws outsiders to the restaurant and hot snacks sold in the bakery at lunch time. Shops include several food shops, hardware, confectioners, Post Office, betting shop, off licence and electrical shop. The square is used by many{local {people,}but car owners prefer to shop in the Marlowes, Hemel or Watford or Brent Cross for larger items.
